Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blbovka
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in March, about £45 a night. Best feature about this hotel is the location. We hardly got a metro anywhere. if you like hiking you can make it up to the castle through placa de espanyol or all the way down las ramblas to the beach. But also very close to the metro for those that prefer that option. Looks like a great location for clubbing. But if you are not a clubber you might find like me, that you get woken up by them coming back to the hotel in the wee hours of the morning. Apart from the noise we didn't have any issues with the hotel but didn't find it anything special either. Breakfast was very expensive so didn't try it, not a problem, plenty of great places outside! Best one we found was Dino pan, not far away on Avinguda de Roma. Also quite a few options for dinner around. The tapas place almost opposite was very nice. If this was the best price, then I would possibly stay here again, but I would be looking for other options first.

Reviews.Title: “NH Master”
Reviews.Author: MartijnG3
Reviews.Content: Rooms are average size but enough room for 2 people including luggage. Didnot use the breakfast since it was €20 per person per day. Hotel is located 10 minutes from 2 subway stations so can be reached easiliy. Walking distance to La Rambla is about 20 minutes walk which is not to fare away. Distance to the beach is about 30 minutes including a walk and 2 subway lines. Wi Fi is included and in the area there are a couple of restaurants which offers breakfast, lunch and diner.

Reviews.Title: “Great disappointment !”
Reviews.Author: elodTlv
Reviews.Content: Many of my expectations were not met and I will NOT stay here again. This hotel is not suitable for business customers. Warning: If you rely on being connected to the internet ('always on') - don't stay here !!! Pros: - room rate - friendly staff Cons: - lousy yet expensive internet experience !!! In the lobby it's free, BUT sloooooow (128 kbps) and annoying (you must re-enter a username/password every 30 minutes). In the room it's pricy (over 10 Euro for 24 hours slow connection, over 17 Euro for 24 hours "business" connection) and limited to a single device. - location is 'ok', but nearest metro is some 7-10 minutes walk (depending on the line you need). - room is too hot (the air-condition can only make it warmer, but can't cool it down) - some rooms (like mine) are interior so you have no view out of the window (except an air chimney) - no coffee/tea in the room (you can have one at the lobby, at an extra cost) - one morning they forgot to clean up my room !! - there is no iron available even if you ask for it (but they do offer paid ironing service) - breakfast is fair but if you prefer vegetables over meat for breakfast then don't expect too much (cold boiled egg, fruits, cheese, corn flakes, bakery, almost no vegetables)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not too far from center”
Reviews.Author: Bella1106
Reviews.Content: I experienced the NH Master in Barcelona as a very pleasant and friendly place, although the staff seems a bit overextended with any request that is beyond standard. For example somehow, in my booking there was no early check-in remark and they just refused to give me a room though they had something available, just that they wanted me to pay extra although I had definitely booked it. But else, the hotel is nice, good breakfast, not too far from the city centre and also the rooms are – as in very NH – more than ok.

Reviews.Title: “NH guarantee.”
Reviews.Author: Taxsideyths
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel into the NH standards. Clean, quiet, smart decorated with comfortable beds. Its location is a quiz. If you choose it during the Formula 1 days, it is good because it is ~20 minutes walk (1,5 km & easy to find, for Sat - Sun is ok) to the train station (Sants Estació) to Montmello. If that is not your case and you are interested in sightseeing downtown the nearest Metro line (Urgell) is ~600 meters (a little bit inconvenient). The breakfast is quite good (try it!). The great plus of this hotel is the staff. Warm, with a big smile on their faces and always willing to help you. The Great MINUS is the price. It is expensive, especially for nowadays.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Missulrik
Reviews.Content: Good service, quite small but clean rooms, furniture somewhat worn. However, if you just stay for business and do not have much time to stay in the room and do not need much comfort, the place will definitely do. The wake up call was on time - something that hardly ever works in hotels these days :-)

Reviews.Title: “20 min. from turistic centre, but worth staying here”
Reviews.Author: Navutu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. Very clean and comfortable rooms (you can even choose from 5 or 6 different pillows if you want). The shower has a firm stream (disadvantage is that the bathroom gets wet after taking a shower). After cheking in and visiting our room we asked for a new room, because this first room (105) had a sigarette smell. Our next room (201) had a better and fresh vibe with a bigger window overlooking a courtyard and basketball field. Free wifi in the lobby is a nice service, but logging on to the hotel network is not an easy job. Despite of the special offer when cheking in (approx. 10 euro per person) we did not make use of the breakfast service, but went out for a breakfast at Dino's around the corner (2,20 euro a person!). The area of the hotel has a lot of nice restaurants and some small convenience stores. Advantage of this area is that you are away from the touristic hassle and noise. Disadvantage of the location of the hotel is that the neareast metro station and Turistic Bus stop is about 15-20 min. walk. But if you want to explore the area this is a good opportunity. A taxi will take your for about 8-10 euro to Plaza Catalunya (20 min walk) and 35 euro from the airport. Despite this hotel is not close to the Ramblas I would still recommend going here and use it as comfortable base to get some rest during your stay in Barcelona with comfortable beds and a good price/quality rate.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy & Nickel and Dimed to Death”
Reviews.Author: BostonLooking
Reviews.Content: 1. My room was right outside the elevators and thus the maids closet. The maid continously dropped her mop outside my room. Pergo/ laminate floors in rooms and tile in hallways makes for VERY noisy rooms. The walls are VERY thin and you can hear people in the next rooms (forget it if they drop something sizeable or slam the door on the fridge). 2. I was also VERY upset with the 11.00 Euro a day charge for internet in the rooms, that was crazy. All other hotels offer it, so why not? They couldn't give a reasonable answer. 3. I was with a large group of 10 people. Every other room in our group breakfast was provided, yet I had to pay 14 euros for what amounted to coffee and a danish. When I quizzed/ complained why I had to pay.. I was told to call the travel agent in Dallas. 4. The other three hotels we stayed at in Spain all offered free wifi in room and free minibar, so I guess I am a bit spoiled since this chain appears to offer nothing but the basics. Won't be staying at an NH Master hotel again as there are many other better choices that offer more and often at better prices. Also NO Pool, spa, workout rooms etc.

Reviews.Title: “The location is not so great but the room is very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy62
Reviews.Content: We booked for 4 of us (2 adults and 2 teenagers) 2 double rooms and we have got 1 double and 1 triple room. Because the great deal of Yeego it was worth for the money. The rooms and bathrooms are big enough and very clean. In room there are minibar and safe use for free. Cons are: lighting in room is not bright enough; noises of the drainage of other rooms; no free Wifi in room (a little bit passe). The location is not so great. The nearest metrostation (Hospital Clinic) is 3 long blocks away/about 10 minutes walking and the more accessible Urgell is 4 blocks away. Although the area Eixample is easily accessible. Breakfast is very straightforward (no eggs) but ok. Only they do not refill quiclkly the food so many times we need to ask for more food. A big Plus: JURA coffeemachine for a perfect cup of coffee! Parking: there is a parking in hotel but only for very small cars. So we park our car in the public garage just around the corner of the hotel. The NH-hotel quests receive a discount. Although the reception is very helpfull and friendly we don't think to book this hotel again because the location is not convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: eded2005
Reviews.Content: Very new and well taken care, excellent breakfast, you can take the airport bus 5 blocks form the hotel, not close to any major local attraction and keep in mind that you will have to walk three long blocks to the nearest subway station.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to reccommend”
Reviews.Author: kotzeto
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights with friends and enjoyed the stay.The staff are very polite and all speak perfect english.Rooms are spacios with large bathrooms.A clean and very well maintained hotel.Breakfast is really nice.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend”
Reviews.Author: knpderby
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the nh forum for one night and then went to madrid and then back to barcelona where we then stayed in nh master for 3 nights. nh master is a nicer hotel, and is far more central for most of the touristy things to do in barcelona. we would recommend this hotel, however would like to point out that if you have drinks from the minibar in the hotel, you will need to pay tax on it (which we didn't in nh forum). the hotel foyer is very nice, the room and the bathroom were really lovely. if you want to use the wifi you need to use it in the foyer and only get an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Eurochic28
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay in Barcelona. didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel but it was very well located on a quiet street a stones throw from two metro stations (Hospital clinic and Urgell) and easy walking distance to just about everywhere! We walked one day to Montjuic and then down to the harbour, up the Ramblas and back to the hotel (admittedly with a rather long visit to a local bar en route!). Didn't eat breakfast here but plenty of places nearby. Hotel is on Valencia and on the next roal up (Mallorca I believe) and a few streets along towards town (east?) there is a fab place called La Baguetteria (or something similar) which sells the BEST tortilla baguettes! don't expect to have much luck with people speaking English in the area as it is all very local but for us that was part of the appeal. Everyone we met was very friendly and we were able to communicate easily with the few words we had in common plus a bit of "sign language"

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Sazhp
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly, convenient location between two tube stations and near quite a few bars! Staff were friendly and helpful and readily offered any info we required from maps to advice. The room smelled of smoke a little but not enough to bother us. Breakfast was lovely, a buffet with a wide variety of foods available. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “FRIENDLY AND CLEAN HOTEL, BUT.....”
Reviews.Author: rob106
Reviews.Content: Hotel room extremely clean and tidy, and reception staff very helpful, but there were two problems with this hotel. Don't expect to come back after a busy day sightseeing and get a drink, bar closes at 1800(although there is a bar on opposite corner of road), also, if it's a coffee in your room you're after,tough, there are no milk portions in your room to go with your other sachets, and reception were unable to provide any! Other than that,location is pretty good, and there is a good pizza restaurant a few roads down ( on the road where the airport bus drops you off).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, definitely worth checking it out!”
Reviews.Author: SandraA22
Reviews.Content: Prompt check-in with good English speaking reception staff. Room was pleasant, a decent size (have stayed in much smaller) and was very quiet, we didn't hear any noise. Our room overlooked other flats and tennis courts so not a great view but we spent very little time in the room. Wonderful, comfy pillows! Mini bar/fridge available in the room and not too badly priced. Breakfast was worth the cost with a good choice of food available, definitely worth checking it out.Secure safe available in the room. Nh Master is about a 15-20 minute walk to Passeig de Gracia then another 10 mins to Las Ramblas but a very pleasant walk and easy to catch the Metro at Urgell which is a 10 minute walk away. Would definitely stay here again even though it is a bit further out from the centre, I was pleased I hadn't booked a hotel on Las Ramblas as that was so busy and noisy.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: sal5815
Reviews.Content: hotel was really nice and staff were attentive without being all over you.the rooms were a little bit small but sufficient to needs.didnt go into restaurant as prefered to walk and get something to eat at one of the many cafes dotted along the way. it was about a 20 minute walk to la rambla but there was so much too look at on the way that the time passed really quickly. this hotel is in a very nice area and althoughit was on a main road there was double glazing so wasnt bothered with passing traffic noise

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dellya
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, spacious rooms with new furniture, modern, very clean, nice staff and good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: austin_mini69
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Barcelona before, my fiancé and I were glad to have chosen this hotel! A taxi from the airport can get you to outside the front door, so no worries about finding the place. First impressions: Air conditioned reception, clean, bright, modern and a good welcome. Check in was simple and swift, and there is a lift to all floors. The room was lovely. Were allocated a twin, and the beds did tend to drift apart, as mentioned in another review. It wasn't a massive problem though, as when we went it was VERY hot and quite nice to have your own space. The rooms are air conditioned, and this was welcome relief after long, hot days. The housekeeping staff were excellent, and we had clean sheets put on our bed each day, aswell as clean towels. (If you are very environment aware, this may not strike you as fantastic, but you can request that this doesn't happen). The room was always tidied when we returned at the end of the day. The hotel is in a good location. It may seem like it isn't, but it won't take five minutes to get on the tube (Urgell or Hospital Clinic) and get to the location you want to go to. My fiancé and I used the Barcelona card for this, which I would reccomend if you are going. The metro is nothing to be worried about. Very clean and air conditioned. I would reccomend though, that wherever you are in Barcelona, you keep your wits about you, and don't fall into tourist traps! Carry a small bag, and keep it with you at all times. Just a final word, the hotel staff were great, and really helped us with useful information about the area. Would certainly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fine location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: hughesef
Reviews.Content: Im a bit late writing this review but I stayed here in September 2009 for 5 days with one other person. We arrived early from a flight and our room was ready which was nice since we had traveled a far distance. Rooms were comfortable, nice size bathroom. The location was a bit far but we were able to walk almost everywhere, and cabs were readily available for places we could not walk to. The staff was very helpful in providing directions and suggesting restaurants. I would stay here again if in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy hotel, far away from the center, with non-super staff and bugs in bathroom”
Reviews.Author: jejansse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at room 114 of the NH Master Hotel Barcelona in Juli for four days in the light of a city trip to Barcelona. The staff at the reception was ok, not superfriendly, just ok. The staff at the breakfast was unable to speak English, however. The first day of breakfast one of the staff just came up to us and said something in Spanish, which we did not understand. After a while it became clear that she wanted to know the room number. However, she didn't understand the room number, so we had to point it out. I find it quite unacceptable to have non-English speaking staff at the breakfast in an international hotel. Regarding the room then. In the bathroom there was a tile with a huge crack that housed some form of bugs. During the first night there I noticed one bug in the bathroom, but just assumed that it got there by accident. The next day I however noticed that there was more than one. Next to this, the room was also very noisy. Apart from having paper walls between different rooms, during the night I could constantly hear the elevator moving, closets opening, curtains being drawn in other rooms etc. Furthermore, the window constantly shivering due to the traffic outside, which caused a lot of noise as well. Needless to say, sleeping was made quite hard due to all of this noise. Last, the hotel is quite far from the center. Although Casa Mila and Casa Battlo are quite nearby. We didn't find this to be such a great deal, as we are accustomed to walking great distances, but it is something to bear in mind. Concluding, I would not recommend this hotel due to the bugs in the bathroom, the noise and the not so helpful breakfast staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in middle of Eixample - Fine rooms and friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: Sairlines
Reviews.Content: We have a very nice stay in this hotel! The staff of the hotel is super friendly and always helpfull and smiling. La Pedrera from Gaudi is just 10 minutes walk away and the neighbourhood is residential and feels very safe, seemed where the 'real Barcelona' people hang-out. Rooms are clean with wooden floors and nicely decorated, spacious bathroom and bed is comfortable. Delicious breakfast buffet with lot of fresh fruits and Spanish delicatesse!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Delta31tr
Reviews.Content: We have booked this hotel 3 weeks before departure. The Hotel is at a very nice urban location, away from all that touristic feeling, where you have a chance to see the real barcalona. Staff was very friendly, helped us with all our requests (bookings at clubs and restaurants, traveling etc). We have moved from an other otel to NH Master, so having the chance to compare two otels. For the price we payed we were fully satisfied with the hotel and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “good deal for the price in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Herr55Pdog
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the NH Master during Xmas so vacinity was in a bit of siesta mode, great spot to get the feel of urban Barca with tourist sites in good proximity. This older building is not the best of NH's portfolio, but the staff was great: friendly and accomodating (made exception for our small dog), parking reasonable (approx 18 euro a day) and overall the hotel and room was in good shape, nice flatscreen tv with multiple language channels. Excellent location for walking to numerous landmarks, and very near public transport. NH Master another reason I usually stick with NH brand while euro- travelling.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful small hotel, at a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: dessitka77
Reviews.Content: I've been at the hotel a week ago and I really enjoyed my stay there. I was fascinated of the atmosphere, the services, the people that work there, the food and the location. It is not far from the city center, we've walked approximately 15 minutes to reach Passeign de Gracia; the metro station Urgell is also 10 minutes walk. It is a very nice small hotel and I felt terrific all the time. Everything was perfect and in order!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel with fantastic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Brockval
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel. The rooms are of an adequate size and clean. The beds are comfortable. It is only 20 minutes walk from the station and well placed for most of the popular sights. It was possible to walk everywhere. It is situated in a nice area with plenty of bars and cafes around. The breakfast was superb, we especially liked the large choice of fruits, breads and cold meats. There was everything there that you could possibly want. The staff were friendly and spoke very good English apart from one blonde lady on reception who found it very difficult to smile or give advice in any way, I suggest she needs to attend a welcome host course. The hotel was very clean, the rooms and the public areas. The one thing that let it down was that the bar was not open on any of the three nights we were staying, bearing in mind it was a Friday, Saturday and Sunday evening. It would have been nice at the end of a long day to have relaxed with a drink back at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 Star Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Pablo_M
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Barcelona for new years eve in December 2007 with two others. We shared a triple room and stayed for three nights. The Hotel is located in the L´Eixample area of Barcelona, North/North-West from the popular La Rambla and Barri Gottic. The Hotel itself is a standard tourist class hotel with all modern ammenities & facilities that you would expect from a 3 star hotel. Our room was a decent size as far as European hotel rooms go, with a TV (including pay tv channels), the bathroom a good size and clean, a desk/cabinet and wardrobe. The room had just enough space to fit all our large bags, however sharing a room between three people can lead to challenges with luggage space at times. The bedding was average, but suitable and the linen was clean. We found the airconditioning in the room to be weak (even when set to the highest level), it was not sufficient, this led to some discomfort during the night, the room became stuffy so we had to open the window which ended up letting in some noise along with the fresh air. The hotel staff were very friendly, helpful and professional at all times. The hotel is not exactly a short walking distance from major tourist attractions but all are accessible via the Barcelona underground train system, it is cheap to travel on and easy to navigate, there are stations nearby such as Urgell and Universitat. Overall we enjoyed our short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dan022
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 08, and had a fantastic time. We arrived very late and were given a very small room (which for a night or two, would be ok), we came straight back down and were moved the following day...no problems. The staff were fantastic, the guys on recepton could'nt do enough for us - very friendly. The hotel is a little further back, from the very centre of Barcelona, but is no more than a pleasant 20 min stroll, or just round the corner was a tube stop. This is only a small hotel so has quiet a nice feel to it, there is a bar but was not always open. FAB hotel for people that will be out exploring Barcelona. When we went this hotel was much better value than other similar standard hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - shame about the beds”
Reviews.Author: jeanrelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at NH Master in Barcelona. Was very new looking and reception were very pleasant and helpful. Some staff had limited english. The room was very modern - had a window that opened onto a central light area with no views at all. Did not worry us. Airconditioning was hard to work out, so spent a few nights quite hot. The worse was the bed situation - as they were singles pushed together. With no clasp to keep the beds together it was not very romantic! I will email and complain to the NH group (as there are many hotels) but will want to double check this next time. Towels and linen were all clean and new - would recommend highly but watch for the bed situation. Location was ok...although next time I would pick a hotel near the metro Jaume - as we walked down that way for all the better restaurants.

HotelInfo.Name: NH Master
HotelInfo.Address: Valencia 105-107, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
